Description: Amulet of the Hathor cow. Amulet of the Hathor cow in relief, walking to the left. Traditional representation with disc and horns in opaque black glass, matt surface. After moulding, wide opaque white strips were impressed into the top surface at irregular intervals. The relief of this amulet is higher and more massive than is usual among similar amulets.
Curator's comments: The technique of impressing strips of glass into the top surface of another piece of glass is first found in the Eighteenth Dynasty but is rare in late work.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.38, pp.36-37)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Constantine A W Schmidt-Ciazynski
